sourcesContent:
import React, { Component } from 'react'; import { Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import Sidebar from './sidebar'; class Starss extends Component { render() { let publicUrl = process.env.PUBLIC_URL + '/' let imagealt = 'image' return (

  • 28 March 2025

Stars In Astrology

üåü Using Nakshatra Symbols for Success

Incorporating the symbols of your Moon Nakshatra into your study or workspace can enhance personal growth and success. For example:

  • Moon in Mrigashira: ü¶å Place a painting of a deer's head in your study.
  • Moon in Dhanishta: üé∂ Keep an actual flute in your workspace.
  • Moon in Chitra: üíé Carry a pearl with you or place it nearby.

Alternatively, you can use the symbol of your 10th lord Nakshatra or Lagna Nakshatra. For instance, if your 10th lord is in Purvashada, you might keep a painting of an elephant tusk in your study starting on a Tuesday.

üóìÔ∏è Nakshatra Symbols Based on Nature, Day, and Activities

For overall success in specific areas, consider using these Nakshatra symbols starting on the assigned days:

1. Tikshna (Sharp)

Nakshatras: Moola, Jyeshta, Ardra, Ashlesha

üíÄ Suitable for destructive activities such as incantations or ending toxic relationships, performed on a Saturday. You might keep a circular amulet, umbrella, or earring starting Saturday.

2. Sthira (Fixed)

Nakshatras: Rohini, Uttaraphalguni, Uttarashadha, Uttarabhadra

üå≥ Ideal for stable activities like laying foundations or planting trees, on a Sunday. Use a chariot planter or garden decor in your backyard starting Sunday.

3. Chara (Movable)

Nakshatras: Sravana, Dhanishta, Satabhisha, Punarvasu, Swati

üöó Best for movement-based activities like acquiring vehicles or traveling, on a Monday. Use a painting of an empty circle, stars, or flute at your office or garage.

4. Ugra (Violent)

Nakshatras: Bharani, Magha, Purvaphalguni, Purvashadha, Purvabhadra

üî• Suited for confrontational activities like demolishing or interviews, on a Tuesday. Keep a picture of a hammock, elephant tusk, or throne in your pocket or desk.

5. Mishra (Mixed)

Nakshatras: Krittika, Vishakha

üåÄ Great for buying electronics or worship on a Wednesday. Decorate your media room or store with a triumphal arch or potter's wheel symbol.

6. Kshipra (Swift)

Nakshatras: Ashvini, Pushya, Hasta, Abhijit

‚ö° Perfect for quick actions like medicine or travel, on a Thursday. Use a horse‚Äôs head, lotus, arrow, or circle symbol in gyms, pharmacies, or travel zones.

7. Mrdu (Tender)

Nakshatras: Chitra, Anuradha, Mrigashira, Revati

üé® Suitable for subtle work like learning arts or ceremonies on a Friday. Decorate your space with a triumphal arch, lotus, pair of fishes, or simply a pearl.

üåå 27 Nakshatras and Their Symbols

{[ ["Ashwini", "Ketu", "üê¥ Horse's head"], ["Bharani", "Venus (Shukra)", "üîª Yoni"], ["Krittika", "Sun (Surya)", "üî™ Knife"], ["Rohini", "Moon (Chandra)", "üõ∫ Chariot"], ["Mrigashira", "Mars (Mangal)", "ü¶å Deer's head"], ["Ardra", "Rahu", "üíß Teardrop"], ["Punarvasu", "Jupiter (Guru)", "üì¶ Quiver of arrows"], ["Pushya", "Saturn (Shani)", "üå∏ Cow's udder"], ["Ashlesha", "Mercury (Budh)", "üêç Serpent"], ["Magha", "Ketu", "üëë Royal throne"], ["Purva Phalguni", "Venus (Shukra)", "üõèÔ∏è Hammock"], ["Uttara Phalguni", "Sun (Surya)", "üîó Cot legs"], ["Hasta", "Moon (Chandra)", "‚úã Hand"], ["Chitra", "Mars (Mangal)", "üíé Jewel"], ["Swati", "Rahu", "üå¨Ô∏è Coral"], ["Vishakha", "Jupiter (Guru)", "üåø Arch"], ["Anuradha", "Saturn (Shani)", "üî± Staff"], ["Jyeshta", "Mercury (Budh)", "üíç Circular amulet"], ["Mula", "Ketu", "üå± Tied roots"], ["Purva Ashadha", "Venus (Shukra)", "üêò Elephant tusk"], ["Uttara Ashadha", "Sun (Surya)", "üè≥Ô∏è Small bed"], ["Shravana", "Moon (Chandra)", "üëÇ Ear"], ["Dhanishta", "Mars (Mangal)", "üé∂ Drum or flute"], ["Shatabhisha", "Rahu", "üí† Circle"], ["Purva Bhadrapada", "Jupiter (Guru)", "üî• Front legs of cot"], ["Uttara Bhadrapada", "Saturn (Shani)", "üí¶ Twins or snake"], ["Revati", "Mercury (Budh)", "üêü Pair of fishes"], ].map(([nakshatra, lord, symbol], idx) => ( ))}
Nakshatra Lord Symbol
{nakshatra} {lord} {symbol}
) } } export default Starss;
